instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: 00281 - No Backlight, no image, no hints
threads.message:
Not entirely sure of history, no water damage visible anywhere. Tried the usual SMC/PRAM reset. Bare board boots ok to OS on external.

Screen seems detected, <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is high as is <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.  I can't make out an image but I seldom can with these.  I looked under the scope for moving LCD pixels etc...  Different screen same story (genuine 2017 screen)

I'm not too sure what to check next, backlight is not being enabled, but i've already checked the fuse (fine, 12.56v both sides) and <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> (missing).  No short on PPVOUT Backlight

threads.title: 00281 - No Backlight, no image, no hints
threads.message:
Image should come before backlight.
Use powerful flashlight to check for image.

Check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH</SIGNAL>/INT lines of J8500.
May have a problem with AMUX <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.

threads.title: 00281 - No Backlight, no image, no hints
threads.message:
DIode Mode, red on ground:

<SIGNAL>EDP_AUX</SIGNAL> both @ .398
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><[I][B]0-3[/B][/I]> @ .342
every other pin seems ok too

SMC Pullups fine (<RESISTOR>R5351</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5350</RESISTOR>)

I have many spare mux chips of course.  U gotta keep these in stock lol.

Will report back!

threads.title: 00281 - No Backlight, no image, no hints
00281 - No Backlight, no image, no hints
threads.message:
Shouldn't be <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> issue, with posted readings.

Still can't confirm internal image?
It must appear before backlight comes on.
Keep in mind, to avoid video artefacts, backlight is last enabled when machine turns on; and first disabled, when it turns off.

Change the small video cable.
Also inspect J8500 connections.
